question.text: The enzyme recombinase is required at which stage of meiosis?

solution.text: The first phase of Meiosis 1 is Prophase  <math><mn>1</mn><mo>.</mo></math>  It is further divided into five phases.  <math><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></math>  Leptotene: Condensation of Chromatin material takes place in this stage  <math><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></math>  Zygotene: The homologous chromosome formation is seen in this stage and formation of synaptonemal complex occurs.  <math><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></math>  Pachytene: At this point a tetrad of chromosomes is formed and this is known as bivalent. Crossing over is also seen in this stage Thus recombination nodules are formed which requires Recombinase enzymes.  <math><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo></math>  Diplotene: The synaptonemal complex degrades and chaismata formation is seen.  <math><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo></math>  Diakinesis: This is the final stage of Prophase. Here the chromosomes condense further. Four proper tetrads are visible. This marks the end of Prophase-1
